name: Custom Biotics - Trashing the Sentry
description:
Decklist I used at my local game shop's league event, Iain Sterling vs. Custom Biotics. It went 2-0, these were the only two times I played the deck.

This deck contains mostly sentries. The idea here is that it makes basically every other breaker except Killers a dead draw. Also, I only have to worry about trashing one type of breaker with a piece of ice, power shutdown, corporate troubleshooter, or agsec. Wraparound is there for mid-late game gear check, and hopefully make it so you can sneak out an agenda. In the two games that I played I actually never landed a corporate troubleshooter or a power shutdown. The econ can sometimes be kind of light, since there isn't that much burst, so you have to wait for drip econ like adonis. There are 20 pieces of ice and 3 jacksons so usually you can afford to use accelerated beta test.

I'd like to keep testing this deck, because it's kind of fun to play with.

name: Kate Atman
Teaching Jinteki: Multi-Core Personal Evolution
Teaching Haas-Bioroid: Multi-Core Engineering the Future
Teaching NBN: Multi-Core Making News
Teaching Weyland: Multi-Core BBW
Teaching Shaper: Multi-Core Kate
Teaching Anarch: Multi-Core Noise
Teaching Criminals: Multi-Core Gabe
Non-veggie sandwitch
description: The idea 4 this deck came from a friend, who played a very similar deck, during our regionals. Its pretty straightforward: you try to blow up the runner with net and meat dmg :)

name: Runner Teaching Deck
description:
Kate will focus on getting out a full compliment of icebreakers (some search cards included), and will also build a strong economy with Magnum Opus. Cards up to What Lies Ahead (first data pack, mandatory pack anyway because corp needs it)

Every card should be readily understood, and there should be a minimum of rules clarifications necessary.

name: Single Core Modernism
description: First change to make is to switch out Paper Wall for Bastion. But I also felt that this deck died super hard to corroders, so I need to address the ice arrangement. Perhaps Datapike or a cheaper EtR sentry if I can find one.

name: Corp Teaching Deck
description:
Weyland focuses on economy and "standard" ICE with a trap or two for sting. Cards up to What Lies Ahead (first data pack, mandatory pack anyway because corp needs it)

Every card should be readily understood, and there should be a minimum of rules clarifications necessary.

name: Prepaid Event Toolbox (V1.3 possibly FINAL)
description:
OK, after further testing I came to add a few tweaks from the "1.2 version". -1 Lucky Find, -1 Satellite Uplink, -1 Garrote. These were changed into +1 The Maker's Eye, +1 Blackmail and +1 Alias. I found Garrote's install cost was a bit too steep and if need be you can always blast a Faerie into a remote. Blackmail was just as situational as Satellite Uplink but it's surprising how much it can help against certain IDs and otherwise can easily be a discard. Lastly I found that even though you can tutor easily for events just one more The Maker's Eye can really boost aggression and is always welcome since Ken is somewhat of a "criminal shaper" of sorts.

THE REST IS JUST WHAT I PREVIOUSLY WROTE WITH MINOR EDITING FROM 1.2:

Here's the main change: WAIT! NO Plascrete Carapace!? Damn right! Lawyer Up is a BEAST in this deck. I always found plascretes to be a clunky necessary evil but now it no longer matters. As a rule of thumb I often found myself using Account Siphon on maximum click 2 against NBN or Weyland and spending 4 of the credits I earned just removing tags. With Prepaid VoicePAD you can have your cake and eat it too! Also see Lawyer Up as a 2 click in-faction diesel if you have your prepaids and they're even actually Same Old Thing worthy after siphoning. Genreally at that point you'll have so much more money that midseasons and scorches won't touch you and you'll have a full hand to boot.

Your main players here are Prepaid VoicePAD, Planned Assault, Quality Time and Same Old Thing. These all work together to tutor fast for cheap and recurr what you want in a blink. Levy AR Lab Access is there as your backup or once your rig is established to bring those tutors back to spam events super cheap.

I find Public Terminal to actually really suck compared to Prepaid VoicePAD because they're too situational based on your draw and corp players are smart enough to know they must protect from the run events Inside Job, The Maker's Eye and Account Siphon.

Programs are simple, my friends know me as "that guy who loves Faerie" when playing criminal but they are a fantastic way to facecheck without major repercussions and most of the time whenever I have a Special Order without a good program rig and cards are unrezzed I'm left wishing I had one instead to just go aggro.

name: Long Term Investment Solutions
description:
This deck is designed to force the runner to spend as much as possible for every run, while goading them into making non-scoring runs to shut down your cash flow. Meanwhile, every agenda either taxes the runner or improves the corps position if stolen.

It has proven to be incredibly successful in tournament play. If the runner tries to destroy all of the assets they bankrupt themselves. If they do not, the corp quickly earns enough credits to casually rez huge ice and make Ash insurmountable.

The deck has no traps, but the threat alone is enough to slow most runners down. It's also not inherently a flatline deck, but Komainu, Tsurugi and Shinobi will devour the unwary. Shinobi in particular is a late game winner - it is not uncommon to have 30-40 credits when this pops up.

Running it is fairly simple. Protect what centrals you can turn one and try to install an econ asset. PADs are the best choice early, but sacrificing a Sundew can be useful in shutting down the runners tempo. If you're feeling bold, run a medical breakthrough or NAPD naked.

After that, put taxing ice over your centrals, play out assets whenever possible and create one remote that's pricey to break. Then install Ash and/or Caprice and start scoring.

name: Harmony Medtech Long-Game
description: This deck is loosely based on a deck I saw Team Covenant run. It's purpose is to Force the runner into running on traps that will end up killing them, if it doesn't win through simply scoring twice. I'm not 100% happy with the ice load out, but i'm trying to put in as many different ways to End the run as I can.

name: The Murder Division (V1.0)
description:
I tried making a similar deck in the past using Scorched Earth and the big problem is that once someone spotted one, I found myself in a hard spot dealing with a plascrete.

The idea is to spam agendas with 3 requirement in the open and triple advance them the turn later while keeping the runner terrified of Psychic Field.

I won't lie, the econ is harsh. Medical Research Fundraiser is better than Celebrity Gift in this case because you mostly want to keep your hand a secret and it combos nicely with Closed Accounts.

The only odd agenda in here is The Future Perfect and is not intended to be scored.

The object is to forfeit a False Lead once the runner accesses a Psychic Field or a Snare! and make them pay dearly for it or just keep advancing to your heart's contempt.

Viktor 2.0 is there so you can leisurely sit on the hosted power counter and redeem it on the runner's turn. Eli 1.0 is good in front of them because they are either quite taxing or sometimes with a sentry breaker someone will click through it to see what's on the other side and will be unable to break the subroutines.

name: Medtech FA
description:
Inspired by the latest Team Covenent video I made a Medtech FA deck, in my short testing this is bananas. It's rush mixed with fast advance, and my god can you win fast. It competes with astrobiotics on scoring speed. Sweeps + MHC can also get ridiculous. I love how drawing for agendas has 0 feelbads of discarding cards because typically they're shock and shi.kyu, which makes your 1 Susan so much mobetter.

Try it, you'll like it.

name: "Yellow Jinteki" test.
description:
Ok,

So this deck has all the goodies of the standard NBN FA but with Inazuma and Shinobi being hidden superstars. It's meant to be played in a very straightforward fashion with the option to insta-kill out of nowhere.

It's very hard to pull off but RSVP + Inazuma + Shinobi = DEATH!

Now i am NOT banking on it. In fact don't. Those cards already work beautifully with others to trash programs or give mean surprises when needed but in late game you can pull off the odd crazy stunt.

name: NBN: The Neural is Yours*
description:
This is actually derived from a Nisei Division: The Next Generation deck I made but thought this may be worth a try.

Do your standard FA tactics and occasionally install Psychic Field in your scoring remote. With the sense of urgency the runner will always want to see what it is and if you scored one False Lead you could forfeit it and EMP them!

RSVP will still peak their curiosity and then you just gamble 1 in the Psi game to take them to the cleaners.

I chose TWIY* because it's faster to draw up to what you want and this is just a random deck idea but it might work.

name: MGB Green Machine
description: SuperModernism updated to the present.

name: Reina Roja (5/26/14)
If it Bleeds, it Leads v2
description: And hopefully, it will bleed a lot.

name: Spags
ETF SanSan Fa 1.1
Milling Crime
Death by TWO THOUSAND Cuts
description: that's as many as two one thousands. and that's terrible.

name: Freeze Frame - Recycled Sun
description:
This deck is just an experiment in docking the Runner clicks combined with a typical HB Ice Fortress.

Sundews are incredibly useful in this deck. Sitting behind a Janus or a Wotan, the runner will rarely consider them worth the cost of a run. Further protect with a Ruhr valley if really necessary.

name: Arrested Development V0.6
description:
My current program trashing Weyland deck. It's gone down in number of trashing programs recently, as having a bunch of Rototurrets out early is really sad when your opponent has no programs.

I'm really wrestling with finding a way of adding another Aggressive Secretary, as it's a nice non-ICE (and, importantly, non-Sentry, so that you can bust up his or her killer) way to trash programs, but I don't know where I can lose or change anything.

name: Exposed Lies v2.1
description: I'm back down to 45 cards (from 46), but I've lost some programs during that, which may bite me in the butt since I literally just added them. I switched my Express Deliveries into 2 Diesels and a Quality Time since I had the influence. I also added a third Lemuria, as the reusable expose cards are becoming more important to the deck overall.

name: Zen of MirrorMorph
description:
So I built this deck strictly to combo Mushin No Shin, Mandatory Upgrades, and Shipment from Mirrormorph. The idea is to obviously build up enough credits to pull off that combo and install a remote with 3 very taxing pieces of ice after you Mushin No Shin a Mandatory Upgrades. Keep in mind when you Shipment from MirrorMorph you have to pay 3 credits to install the ice.

Biotic Labors are there mainly if you want to Score a Profiteering first, but be careful with scoring Profiteering or rezzing a Fenris if you think they might have Blackmail. If you pull off the combo it is likely game over for them unless they can do a crazy deep dig on R and D or get lucky with a Legwork.

If they happen to get in and steal the Mandatory Upgrades. You can always drop a Corporate War in that server if it left them broke. Then Biotic Labor and score it to get your money back. Also real nice to drop it in there right after you score Mandatory Upgrades. If they are at 0 points they may put all their efforts into getting in there instead of running R&D and HQ. I usually let them steal it, then score my 3/2's out of hand to win. If they don't run it then its an easy score to get more money.

If you are playing Noise you want to Mushin the Mandatory Upgrades with no less than 15 cards left or you may end up getting decked. Happened to me. Honestly against Noise it might be best just to score with Biotic and get them back with Reclamation Order. 3 Archived Memories works great to get back your Reclamation Orders so you can grab back your econ cards again and again. I've even used Reclamation Order to grab my 2 Copies of Archived Memories and then grab that same Reclamation Order with those. Silly combos but its worked.

name: The Murder Division (V1.1)
description:
This is a second attempt at making a Psychic Field based kill deck. Thanks to some pretty good feedback I swapped Viktor 2.0s for Snoops.

The point is pretty simple. Leave 3/2s or fase leads in a remote and triple advance them on the next turn all while spamming Psychic Fields here and there. Keep the runner scared or just punish them harshly for not being careful followed by Neural EMPs.

Econ is tight but it's quite possible to make it work. With Snoop just hold on to your power counter and use it to mess the runner bad after his hand is empty. I splashed in 1 RSVP because it helps with Caprice Nisei, Psychic Field, Snoop's trace and so on.

Medical Research Fundraiser takes importance over Celebrity Gift simply because you're not trying to beat the runner credit for credit and it works well with Closed Accounts not to mention that in this deck you want to keep information hidden.

False Lead is the mvp agenda because once you have one scored, the runner has to be very careful about running your remote and will attempt more central agression where you'll leave the majority of your ICE
